column1: #text=I ride the bus to school everyday .
#text=I live in New York City so riding the bus is a common thing .
#text=Everyone does it because it is convenient .
#text=In our city , it is very packed , so driving is n't as convenient or affordable .
#text=Parking is expensive so public transportation saves us a lot of money .
#text=Every morning when I go to school , I wait by the bus stop .
#text=The morning bus comes every ten minutes .
#text=Once it arrives I board onto the bus and I insert my metro card .
#text=The metro card has a balance of money stored inside it .
#text=This money is subtracted from the balance every time I ride the bus and insert my metro card .
#text=Basically the metro card pays for the bus ride .
#text=When I run out of money , I go to a metro card machine and put more money into my balance .
#text=In the morning , it is very crowded so sometimes there are n't enough seats for everybody .
#text=This means I have to stand while holding on to a pole .
#text=Sometimes its so crowded that I am sandwiched in between people .
#text=If I am lucky , sometimes there will be open seats .
#text=Otherwise , I have to stand for 40 minutes .
